00031 typedef enum _CMDLINE_ERRORS {
00032 
00033         CMDLINE_OK = 0,
00034         CMDLINE_MISSING_ARGUMENTS,
00035         CMDLINE_MISSING_PORT,
00036         CMDLINE_MISSING_COOKIE,
00037         CMDLINE_INVALID_COMMAND,
00038         CMDLINE_INVALID_PORT,
00039         CMDLINE_INVALID_COOKIE,
00040

00057 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00058 
00059         int result;
00060         int port=0;
00061         char *cookie, *command;
00062         pthread_t sThread;
00063 
00064 
00065         result = getOptionsAndCommand(argc, argv, &port, &cookie, &command);
00066         if (0!=result) {
00067                 return 1;
00068         }
00069 
00070         DEBUG_MSG("DEBUG: port    [%u]\n", port);
00071         DEBUG_MSG("DEBUG: cookie  [%s]\n", cookie);
00072         DEBUG_MSG("DEBUG: command [%s]\n", command);
00073 
00074         result = daemon_validate_command(command);
00075         if (0!=result) {
00076                 showMessage( MSG_INVALID_COMMAND );
00077                 return 1;
00078         }
00079 
00080         // if we have a ``start`` command, we need parameters:
00081         if (daemon_is_start_command(command)) {
00082                 result = validatePortCookie(port, cookie);
00083                 if (0!=result) {
00084                         return 1;
00085                 }
00086         }
00087 
00088         // before any threads are started...
00089         signals_init();
00090 
00091         //  DAEMON
00092         // *!*!*!*!
00093         DaemonErrorCode code = daemon_handle_command("phidgetmanager", command);
00094 
00095         // should we exit right now?
00096         if (DAEMON_CODE_EXITING == code) {
00097                 return 1;
00098         }
00099 
00100         // the command was most probably a ``start``
00101         //  but there was an error...
00102         if (DAEMON_CODE_OK != code) {
00103                 handleDaemonErrorCode( code );
00104                 return 1;
00105         }
00106 
00107 
00108 
00109         // *!*!*!*!* START SUCCESSFUL !@!@!@@!@!!@!!
00110         // =========================================
00111 
00112 
00113         /*
00114          *  COMMUNICATIONS
00115          *  ==============
00116          *
00117          *  PhidgetManager  < -- > Erlang Cnode
00118          */
00119 
00120         //{
00121         qpipe *queue_pipe;
00122 
00123         queue_pipe = qpipe_create();
00124         if (NULL==queue_pipe) {
00125                 doLog(LOG_ERR, "unable to create qpipe");
00126                 goto _close;
00127         }
00128 
00129         qport_context *qp_phm, *qp_erl;
00130 
00131         qp_phm = qport_init( queue_pipe, QPORT_0 );
00132         qp_erl = qport_init( queue_pipe, QPORT_1 );
00133 
00134         if (NULL == qp_phm) {
00135                 doLog(LOG_ERR, "unable to create manager port");
00136                 goto _close;
00137         }
00138 
00139         if (NULL == qp_erl) {
00140                 doLog(LOG_ERR, "unable to create server port");
00141                 goto _close;
00142         }
00143         //}
00144 
00145 
00146         //{
00147         server_params params;
00148 
00149         params.port   = port;
00150         params.cookie = cookie;
00151         params.qpc    = qp_erl;
00152 
00153 
00154         int result2 = pthread_create(&sThread, NULL, &server_thread, (void *) &params);
00155         if (result2) {
00156                 showMessage( MSG_ERROR_SERVER_THREAD );
00157                 return 1;
00158         }
00159         //}
00160 
00161 
00162         CPhidgetManagerHandle phidm;
00163         phidm = manager_create( qp_phm );
00164 
00165         // running in the server & manager threads
00166         // at this point
00167 
00168         int signal_caught;
00169 
00170 _close:
00171 //====
00172 
00173         do {
00174                 signal_caught = signals_get_signal();
00175         } while(signal_caught!=SIGTERM || signal_caught!=SIGKILL);
00176 
00177         // TODO send kill message to server thread
00178 
00179 
00180         pthread_join( sThread, NULL );
00181 
00182         doLog(LOG_INFO, "server thread exited");
00183 
00184         return 0;
00185 
00186 }//[/main]

00190 /*
00191  * Displays on stdout a help message
00192  */
00193 void showHelp(int msg_id) {
00194 
00195         const char msg[] = "\
00196 \n Erlang Node Server to Phidget Manager\
00197 \n\
00198 \nUsage:\
00199 \n======\
00200 \n       phidget_erl_manager PORT COOKIE\
00201 \n\n";
00202 
00203         printf( "%s", msg );
00204 
00205         printf( "%s", main_messages[msg_id] );
00206 
00207 }//[/showHelp]

00211  * Show message
00212  */
00213 void showMessage(int msg_id) {
00214 
00215         printf( "%s", main_messages[msg_id] );
00216 
00217 }// showMessage
00218 
00219 void showMessageEx(int msg_id, ...) {
00220 
00221         int _MAX_SIZE = 1024;
00222         int n;
00223 
00224         char *msg_format = main_messages[msg_id];
00225         char *msg_args;
00226 
00227         // if we fail for that small buffer,
00228         //  then the system as a much bigger problem ;-)
00229         msg_args = malloc( _MAX_SIZE * sizeof(char) );
00230         va_list ap;
00231 
00232         va_start(ap, msg_id);
00233                 n = vsnprintf(msg_args, _MAX_SIZE, msg_format, ap);
00234         va_end(ap);
00235 
00236         printf( "%s", msg_args );
00237 }// showMessageEx

00240 /**
00241  * Retrieves the options and the command
00242  *  from the command line
00243  *
00244  */
00245 int getOptionsAndCommand(int argc, char **argv, int *port, char **cookie, char **command) {
00246 
00247         //worst case
00248         *port = 0;
00249         *cookie = NULL;
00250         *command = NULL;
00251 
00252         int c;
00253         char _current_option = ' ';
00254         int  _options_scanning=0;
00255 
00256         opterr = 0;
00257 
00258         while ((c = getopt (argc, argv, "p:c:")) != -1)
00259            switch (c)   {
00260            case 'p':
00261                    if (NULL!=optarg)
00262                            *port = atoi( optarg );
00263                    break;
00264            case 'c':
00265                    if (NULL!=optarg)
00266                            *cookie = optarg;
00267                    break;
00268            case '?':
00269                    _options_scanning = -1; //error
00270                    _current_option = optopt;
00271                    break;
00272            default:
00273                    abort();
00274            }
00275 
00276         if (0!=_options_scanning) {
00277                 if (('p' == _current_option) || ('c' == _current_option)) {
00278                         showMessageEx( MSG_MISSING_OPTION_ARGUMENT, _current_option);
00279                 } else {
00280                         showMessageEx( MSG_INVALID_OPTION, _current_option );
00281                 }
00282                 return 1;
00283         }
00284 
00285         if ((optind > 0) && (optind<argc)) {
00286                 *command = argv[optind];
00287         } else {
00288                 showMessage( MSG_INVALID_COMMAND );
00289                 return 1;
00290         }
00291 
00292 
00293         return 0; // OK
00294 }//getOptionsAndCommand
00295 
00296 /**
00297  * Crude validation of parameters
00298  */
00299 int validatePortCookie(int port, char *cookie) {
00300 
00301         if (0 == port) {
00302                 showHelp( MSG_PORT_INTEGER );
00303                 return 1;
00304         }
00305 
00306         // validate (somewhat) cookie parameter
00307         if (NULL==cookie) {
00308                 showHelp( MSG_COOKIE_STRING );
00309                 return 1;
00310         }
00311 
00312         return 0;
00313 }

00315 /**
00316  *  Prints an error message
00317  */
00318 void handleDaemonErrorCode(DaemonErrorCode code) {
00319 
00320         int msg_id = codeToMsg( code );
00321         showMessage( msg_id );
00322 
00323 }// handleDaemonErrorCode
00324 
00325 /**
00326  * TODO handle this mapping more elegantly...
00327  */
00328 int codeToMsg(DaemonErrorCode code) {
00329 
00330         switch(code) {
00331         case DAEMON_CODE_OK:                                    return MSG_OK;
00332         case DAEMON_CODE_NO_PID_FILE:                   return MSG_NO_PID_FILE;
00333         case DAEMON_CODE_INVALID_NAME:                  return MSG_INVALID_NAME;
00334         case DAEMON_CODE_READING_PID_FILE:              return MSG_READING_PID_FILE;
00335         case DAEMON_CODE_INVALID_PID:                   return MSG_INVALID_PID;
00336         case DAEMON_CODE_READING_PROC_CMDLINE:  return MSG_READING_PROC_CMDLINE;
00337         case DAEMON_CODE_PROC_CMDLINE_NOMATCH:  return MSG_CMDLINE_NOMATCH;
00338         case DAEMON_CODE_INVALID_COMMAND:               return MSG_INVALID_COMMAND;
00339         case DAEMON_CODE_KILL_FAILED:                   return MSG_KILL_FAILED;
00340         case DAEMON_CODE_DAEMON_EXIST:                  return MSG_DAEMON_EXIST;
00341         case DAEMON_CODE_WRITING_PID_FILE:              return MSG_WRITING_PID_FILE;
00342         case DAEMON_CODE_EXITING:                               return MSG_OK; //shouldn't need to use this.
00343         }
00344 
00345         return MSG_CODE_NOT_FOUND;
00346 }// codeToMsg
